The function y = sin(1/x) has x-intercepts where sin(1/x) = 0, which occurs when 1/x = nπ for integer n. This gives x = 1/(nπ). We need x in (0.0001, 0.001), so:

0.0001 < 1/(nπ) < 0.001  
⇒ 1000 < nπ < 10000  
⇒ 1000/π < n < 10000/π  
≈ 318.309 < n < 3183.098

Thus, n ranges from 319 to 3183, inclusive. The number of integers in this range is 3183 - 319 + 1 = 2865.

\boxed{2865}

The function \( y = \sin\left(\frac{1}{x}\right) \) has x-intercepts where \( \frac{1}{x} = n\pi \) for integers \( n \), leading to \( x = \frac{1}{n\pi} \). Within the interval \( (0.0001, 0.001) \), the values of \( n \) range from 319 to 3183, inclusive. The number of integers in this range is \( 3183 - 319 + 1 = 2865 \).

\[ 3183 - 319 + 1 = 2865 \]
